page.title: 08A Walk Up Mulderie _ Mulben
page.content: On Thursday evening, the children in our school who are working on The Doomsday Project went for a walk up to the top of the Hill of Mulderie. We went by car until we reached the forest road. At first, the forest road was very muddy, but as we went higher up ,the road became drier. Mr Duncan showed us how to recognise animal tracks. We saw deer tracks and could see where the path they made led down through the trees, across the road, and on down to the water. Suddenly, we heard a yapping noise that sounded like a puppy. It was a young fox cub barking. We saw some wild ducks, and we collected feathers of the wood_pigeon. At the top of the hill ,we added stones to the cairn. Coming down was much easier than going up.
